description: Conversion of single dwellinghouse into 3no. flats, two-storey side and part two storey rear extension, hip to gable end, installation in solar panels and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope (following demolition of existing single storey side extension, side and rear roof extensions, and partial demolition of existing first floor hipped roof projection to the rear)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s) - 0106-7-00-GA-101 R3-03 - Proposed Site Plan

0106-7-00-GA-201 R3-01 R3-03 - Ground and First Proposed Plans 01, 0106-7-00-GA-202 R3-01 R3-03 - Second and Roof Proposed Floor Plans 02, 0106-7-00-GA-301 R3-01 R3-03 - Proposed Front and Rear Elevations 01, 0106-7-00-GA-302 R3-01 R3-03 - Proposed Flank Elevations 02 and 0106-7-00-GA-303 R3-01 - Proposed Side Elevations 03 (Revised 16/3/2023)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwelling.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Polices D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Polices D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Notwithstanding the approved plans, refuse/recycling storage shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, to protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies SI7 & SI8 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Notwithstanding the submitted plans, 4 cycling spaces for the development shall be provided prior to the first occupation and retained thereafter. The cycle parking spaces shall be secure and covered and shall be retained as such in perpetuity.
Reason: To protect visual amenity and to promote more sustainable forms of transportation, in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing's Sustainable Transport SPG 2019

| The fence line proposed dividing the two garden amenity spaces proposed for each of the flats, shall be divided with a fence of either 2m in height or shall match the height of existing boundary fencing on the site.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development would harmonise with the pattern of surrounding development, in accordance with Policy 7B and LV7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD, Policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.18) and Policies D1 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interests of maintaining good design, protecting local character and to minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in accordance with policies 7.4 an 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021)

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below a kitchen/dining/living room and overlapped by a bathroom of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021).
subdivision_of_building: Proposal relates most notably to the upper floors, most notably the second floor (existing dormer) where a new roof and dormer is being proposed. The ground floor is undergoing change where the side extension is proposed.

open_spaces_details.description: 9sq.m of existing garden space shall be lost where the new two-storey side extension is proposed.
